text: The Osage Round House is a 16-sided structure and is the only such round house standing in Osage County, Oklahoma. == Description and history == It is located on a 40 acres platted separately from the rest of Hominy, and is owned by the Osage Nation. The top of the roof is an opening which is covered with a small conical roof. The vent is used for ventilation, activated by opening the windows and doors. The peak is also used as a bell tower. It was added to the National Register of Historic Places on May 16, 1979. ==References== Category:Houses in Osage County, Oklahoma Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Oklahoma Category:Hominy, Oklahoma Category:National Register of Historic Places in Osage County, Oklahoma Category:Houses completed in 1919
title: Hominy Osage Round House
